abstract: Apple sold 1.7 million more iPhones last year than AT&T activated on its network. The bulk of those, analysts say, were sold to gray market dealers who unlocked them and sold them overseas in countries in which Apple does not yet have a carrier partner.
snippet: Apple sold 1.7 million more iPhones last year than AT&T activated on its network. The bulk of those, analysts say, were sold to gray market dealers who unlocked them and sold them overseas in countries in which Apple does not yet have a carrier pa...
lead_paragraph: Wall Street analysts have begun to search the globe for 1.7 million lost iPhones.

headline.main: Good News in the One Million Missing iPhones
